questions.question: 6. If size of the particle increases 2 times, then K ____.
7. Soils with greater void ratios have ____ permeability.
8. Due to change in temperature, the w and Î¼ of the liquid reduced by 10% and 40% respectively. What is the change in the permeability of the soil?
9. Permeable soil has a K (cm / sec) value of ____.
10. Coefficient of permeability is also called as which of the following?

6. A constant head permeability test on a medium soil sample having a cross sectional area of 7585 mm<sup>2</sup> yielded the following data: Distance between standpipes = 100 mm, Constant head difference = 70.4 mm, Quantity of water collected = 500 * 10<sup>3</sup> mm<sup>3</sup>, Time of collection = 132 s. Determine the coefficient of permeability of sand specimen.

explanations.a: Formula k = Q * L / (a * h * t)

questions.question: 7. In a falling head permeability test, a soil sample of 7585 mm<sup>2</sup> cross-section and 210.2 mm length was subjected to a flow of water from a stand-pipe having cross-sectional area of 730 mm<sup>2</sup>. The stand-pipe level changed from 1650 mm to 550 mm above reservoir datum during a time interval of 182 sec. Determine the coefficient of permeability of the soil.

explanations.a: k = 2.303 * a * L * log (h<sub>1</sub> / h<sub>2</sub>) / (A * t)
